title: Selected Checkbox
reference-overview: The Selected Checkbox is a form add-on that makes it easier for users to see the selections they have made on a form. When the user checks a selection, it will be highlighted in green.
reference-usage: Use the Selected Checkbox when a form contains a large number of possible selections to a question, so users can see what exactly they have checked off. For example, if a user needs to check off countries visited or hobbies/interests, there will most likely be a lot of options on the form. The Selected Checkbox is the perfect option to allow users to keep track of their selections.
reference-details:
When a checkbox is initially selected the Active State (see below) is highlighted using the "Attention" color and the green background indicates selection.

Margins

In order to keep with Mercer consistency, the margins between Elements have been standardized:

  • Use a 10 pixel bottom between the Element and next Field Label.
  • Use a 3 pixel bottom margin between a Label and an Input.

Labels

All field labels should use Title Case. See the Copy/Text Style Guide narrative for more detail.

Active State

The active state for any field should be indicated by the application of the "Attention" color to the border of the specific field the user has clicked into. See Color Palette for more details on "Attention" color.

Designers can apply the CSS class evo-checkbox-checked to the Checkbox element in order to make it a Selected Checkbox with the green background.

Required Fields

All required fields should be denoted by placing the Required icon (the evo-asterisk-small icon from the list of icons ) immediately to the left of the Field Label.

Error Handling

See the Field Specific Error Message page for details.
reference-mobile: Check-boxes expand to the entire row and stacks in order presented, while font size increases. Each option, which can be selected by using the check-box or clicking anywhere in the area, changes color to indicate selection and check-box becomes selected.
reference-code-html-content-block-pre: The selected checkbox allows the user to click and higlight a larger area. For this to work you would need to place a class of js-evo-selected-checkbox on the form tag.
